original:
Founded in 1938 in Montréal, Québec, the Eastern Group of Painters comprised artists from Montréal who shared a common interest in painting and embraced an art-for-art's-sake philosophy. Unlike the Group of Seven or the Canadian Group of Painters, the Eastern Group did not adhere to a nationalist agenda. 

Notable members of the group included Alexander Bercovitch, Goodridge Roberts, Eric Goldberg, Jack Weldon Humphrey, John Goodwin Lym
